name: [Aberration Hunters' Amulet](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Aberration_Hunters%27_Amulet)
effects:
[Ancient Grudges](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Ancient_Grudges) 
Touch your amulet to subsume a sliver of the knowledge of the gith. You gain  [Advantage](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Advantage) on [Attack Rolls](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Attack_Rolls) against [aberrations](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/List_of_Creature_Types#Aberration). ( Recharge: [Short rest](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Short_rest).)

[Aberration Hunter](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Aberration_Hunter)A [githyanki](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Githyanki) wearing this amulet has  [Advantage](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Advantage) on Intelligence  [Saving throws](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Saving_throw). [Aberrations](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Aberration) also have  [Disadvantage](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Disadvantage) on [Attack rolls](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Attack_roll) against them.

name: [Necklace of Elemental Augmentation](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Necklace_of_Elemental_Augmentation)
effects: [Elemental Augmentation](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Elemental_Augmentation)When one of your [cantrips](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/List_of_cantrips) deals [Acid](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Acid), [Cold](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Cold), [Fire](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Fire), [Lightning](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Lightning), or [Thunder](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Thunder) damage, add your [Spellcasting Modifier](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Spellcasting_Modifier) to the damage dealt.

name: [Sentient Amulet (Rare)](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Sentient_Amulet_(Rare))
effects:
[Shatter](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Shatter) 
Cast as a level 2 spell ( Recharge: [Short rest](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Short_rest).)


 [Talk to the Sentient Amulet](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Talk_to_the_Sentient_Amulet) 
Speak with the consciousness lingering inside the Sentient Amulet. 


 [Ki Restoration](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Ki_Restoration_(Lesser)) 
Using the spiritual energy in the amulet, you restore  2 [Ki Points](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Monk#Level_1). ( Recharge: [Long rest](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Long_rest).)

Wearing this amulet applies the condition:

 [High Spirits](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/High_Spirits_(Condition))
The amulet's spirit lingers, making everything seem a little more vibrant. Must succeed a  [Wisdom](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Wisdom)  [Saving throw](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Saving_throw) ([DC](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Difficulty_Class) 10/15, see notes) when using the amulet's power, or become  [Hysterical](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Hysterical_(Condition)) (equivalent in effect to  [Tasha's Hideous Laughter](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Tasha%27s_Hideous_Laughter) with a duration of 1 turn).

name: [Corvid Token](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Corvid_Token)
effects:
[Polymorph: Dire Raven](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Polymorph:_Dire_Raven) 
Take the shape of a dire raven that can avoid attention and  [Blind](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Blinded_(Condition)) enemies. It has  13 [hit points](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Hit_points). ( Recharge: [Long rest](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Long_rest).)

[Boon of the Raven Queen](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Boon_of_the_Raven_Queen)While wearing the amulet, the wearer's jump and flying speed increase by  1.5 m / 5 ft, and they gain the  [Feather Fall](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Feather_Fall_(Condition)) condition. Feather Fall's effect will persist while the wearer is  [Polymorphed](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Polymorphed_(Condition)) or [Wild-Shaped](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Wild_Shape).

name: [Unflinching Protector Amulet](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Unflinching_Protector_Amulet)
effects: [Unflinching Protection](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Unflinching_Protection)When a nearby ally is targeted by an attack of any kind, you can use your  [Reaction](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Actions#Reactions) to make that attack automatically miss. This effect can only be used once per [Short Rest](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Resting#Short_rest).

name: [Amulet of Bhaal](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Amulet_of_Bhaal)
effects: [First Blood](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/First_Blood)On a hit, inflict  [Bleeding](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Bleeding_(Condition)) upon targets that have maximum [Hit Points](https://bg3.wiki/wiki/Hit_Points).
